Woody.Action: Joins in the imaginative play with Andy and other toys.
Says 'You're my favorite deputy' after the play scene, showing friendliness and encouragement.

Andy narrates Woody saving the day by using strategic play with other toys (dinosaur stomping the toy dog), capturing Mr. Potato Head and putting him in jail, showing clever problem solving and leadership.
Woody is passive in the excerpt, mostly serving as a figure in Andy's imaginative play, with no direct autonomous action evident.
Allows Andy and others to play with him enthusiastically, showing tolerance and friendliness.
Lies limp on the sofa showing patience and trustworthiness during play.
Stares in the direction of birthday decorations calmly, showing quiet acceptance.
Allows Andy to use him as a toy, including sliding down banisters, being catapulted, and spun around without protest.
Remains expressionless and immobile on the sofa while Andy talks to his mother and plans the birthday party.
Responds with a fitting voice box phrase ('Somebody's poisoned the waterhole') indicating awareness of the play scenario.
Exhibits no autonomous problem solving, initiative, or skillful action; is essentially passive throughout the excerpt.
Organizes the toys by initiating activity when the coast is clear.
Politely thanks Sargent after asking about Slinky.
Cuts off Slinky’s speech abruptly by putting a hand over his mouth.
Organizes a staff meeting and encourages others to be happy.
Plays and jokes around with Etch-A-Sketch (pretends to be shot).
Responds kindly to Rex's attempt to scare him and reassures Rex.
Organizes a staff meeting quickly and delegates podium duty to Robot and Snake.
Demonstrates confidence and good-natured humor with Etch-A-Sketch’s quick draw game.
Unfazed by Rex's attempt to scare him, responding calmly and confidently.
Momentarily distracted searching for his doodle pad, showing slight disorganization.
Does not immediately react to being grabbed and choked by Bo Peep, shows mild surprise but remains polite.
Thanks Bo Peep modestly after she thanks him for saving her flock, appearing flustered and sincere.
Encourages the toys to pick moving buddies to avoid anyone being left behind, addressing the group seriously.
Snaps out of a lovestruck trance and quickly takes charge by stepping up to the podium to address the toys, handling the microphone and managing technical feedback.
Recognizes the importance of the moving buddy system to ensure no toys get left behind, confidently communicates this to the group despite their initial resistance.
Appears flustered and distracted when talking to Bo Peep, showing a momentary lapse in focus and confidence.
Tries to calm and reassure the other toys about the sudden change in birthday party date, demonstrates leadership by addressing the group and encouraging confidence.
Under his breath, hesitates before announcing the party change, suggesting some uncertainty or nervousness.
Tries to assert control and confidence but the toys still panic and the situation escalates quickly, indicating his reassurance does not fully contain the group.
Fails to prevent panic or prepare the toys effectively for an unexpected event, leading to chaos when guests arrive.
Calms the panicking toys by asking them to stay calm and offering a plan to manage the situation.
Smacks his forehead in surrender when overwhelmed, showing vulnerability and relieving tension.
Organizes a reconnaissance plan to protect the group, showing leadership and care for others' safety.
Maintains calm while others panic; takes charge by organizing a recon post and giving clear, confident orders.
Smacks his hand to his forehead in momentary surrender.
Organizes a reconnaissance plan with the Green Army Men to monitor activities outside the room using a baby monitor, showing strategic planning and use of available resources.
Places the baby monitor to listen for information about the presents, demonstrating thoughtful preparation and intelligence.
Corrects and helps insert batteries in the monitor to keep the group informed
Quickly organizes the toys to get back to their places before Andy arrives, showing leadership and care.
Falls limp and hides unnoticed when Andy arrives, then lies and makes excuses about being under the bed.
Quickly organizes the toys to get back to their places when Andy arrives, showing leadership and situational awareness.
Falls limp and slides unnoticed into a gap under the bed, losing his usual position and causing surprise among the toys.
Attempts to compose himself and make a plausible excuse when found out of place, showing some quick thinking.
Tries to reassure others confidently by denying replacement and suggesting polite welcome, despite evident doubts from others.
Climbs slowly up the side of the bed and cautiously investigates the new toy Buzz Lightyear.
Approaches Buzz with a friendly greeting and quickly apologizes for any fright caused.
Politely tries to explain the situation about his spot on the bed.
Passively allows Buzz to shove him down and activate his laser without resistance.
Introduces himself calmly to Buzz despite Buzz’s aggressive stance, attempts to assert ownership of the bed spot thoughtfully.
Tries to keep up with Buzz as he walks around, showing alertness and social awareness.
Does not directly confront Buzz’s use of intimidation (laser beam), instead tries to reason with him.
Glances down at Buzz’s box quietly, showing curiosity but no overt hostility or rudeness.
Comments to Bo Peep that the other toys act as if they've never seen a new toy before, showing mild skepticism but not harsh judgment.
Glances down at Buzz’s box, noticing the predefined spiel that Buzz is repeating.
Comments to Bo Peep that the other toys seem naive about new toys, indicating awareness.
Insists Buzz isn't a real Space Ranger and denies his abilities repeatedly, showing frustration and unwillingness to accept Buzz's claims.
Attempts to keep the group focused and tries to maintain order by telling others they're impressed with Andy's new toy despite underlying tension.
Stands alone at the other end of the bed, fuming and feeling insecure about his status as Andy's favorite toy.
Dismisses Buzz's flying as 'falling with style,' showing jealousy and a lack of friendliness toward Buzz's accomplishment.
Expresses hope that things will return to how they were and that he is still loved, revealing sincerity in his emotions.
Angrily shakes Etch-A-Sketch to remove Buzz’s image.
Looks under the bed for Slinky, tries to find missing toy.
Kicks the checkerboard in frustration, causing a mishap where a piece hits him in the mouth.
Shoves Slinky off the bed to maintain order and boundaries among toys.
Peeks at Andy sleeping peacefully with Buzz, then closes the toybox lid quietly.
Interacts with the shark playfully by retrieving his hat, shows some humor.
Sarcastic reaction to the shark wearing his hat.
Appears to feel insecure or threatened by Buzz's acceptance among the other toys.
Rejects Bo Peep's comforting words about Andy's affection, responds nonchalantly and evasively.
Shows frustration and anger in response to Mr. Potato Head’s sarcastic comment.
Throws open the toy box lid decisively and searches for his missing hat.
Sarcastically demands his hat back from the shark, then quickly retrieves it.
Looks at his foot to compare his name inscription to Buzz’s, showing awareness of his status.
Acts nonchalant and confused when Bo Peep tries to reassure him, suggesting he is internally struggling but masking it.
Angrily marches across the room in response to Mr. Potato Head's insult and Buzz’s rising status, showing emotional reaction rather than strategic thinking.
Grabs Buzz’s foot and rolls him out from under the ship, asserting ownership over Andy.
Pushes Buzz, causing accidental activation of helmet; unsure how to react to Buzz’s distress.
Mocks Buzz Lightyear by pretending an alien is behind him and laughing at him.
Approaches skateboard, grabs Buzz's foot, and rolls him out from under the ship to confront him.
Tells Buzz to stay away from Andy and asserts ownership confidently.
Pushes Buzz in chest, accidentally activating helmet release, causing Buzz to gasp for air.
Uses trickery to make Buzz look behind at a non-existent alien and laughs at his gullibility.
Is unsure how to react when Buzz gasps for air after helmet is opened.
Protects other toys by closely monitoring Sid’s dangerous behavior and trying to assess the situation carefully.
Dismisses Buzz’s concern by saying 'Nothing that concerns you spacemen. Just us TOYS.'
Uses Lenny the binoculars skillfully to survey and assess the dangerous situation in Sid's backyard.
Attempts to keep Buzz from interfering by redirecting and dismissing him.
Shows awareness and concern about the threat posed by Sid's Combat Carl bomb, indicating situational awareness.
Corrects Buzz's mistaken identifications quickly and confidently.
Presses Buzz’s laser button, demonstrating familiarity with Buzz’s features.
Uses sarcasm to challenge Buzz's plan ('Yeah, sure. You go ahead. Melt him with your scary laser').
Does not intervene physically when Buzz steps onto the ledge despite the danger.
Confidently dismisses Buzz’s claim after the explosion, asserting his own capability ('Buzz, I would love to see you try.')
Perks up with concern on hearing only one toy can be brought, then quickly tries to find a way to be chosen by Andy by using the Magic 8 Ball and investigating its prediction.
Throws the Magic 8 Ball in disgust after getting an unfavorable answer, showing frustration.
Notices a helpless toy trapped, urgently alerts Buzz and tries to organize a rescue.
Attempts to help by using the RC car, but causes unintended chaos leading to dangerous situations.
Quickly identifies the location of the trapped toy and tries to use the RC Car to rescue it.
Causes chaos by steering the RC Car into a bulletin board, leading to a series of dangerous accidents.
Freezes in disbelief after creating the chaotic scene instead of controlling or mitigating it.
Feels distressed and concerned after Buzz is knocked out the window.
Backs away from the commotion unnoticed, showing possible avoidance.
Defends himself sincerely, insists the incident was an accident, and asks others to believe him.
Tries to explain himself and stop the toys from attacking him.
Gets aggressive toward Buzz, leading to conflict with other toys (implied from context).
Tries to explain himself calmly to the other toys when they turn against him.
Allows himself to be driven back to the edge of the desk, appearing trapped by Potato Head and the others.
Watches helplessly as Andy overlooks him and continues searching for Buzz, showing a lack of control over the situation.
Gulps and seems intimidated when confronted by Potato Head’s accusing gesture, indicating insecurity.
Allows Andy to grab him and go without protest, staying close to him.
Comes to life quietly and expresses frustration but no hostility.
Lies passively in the van next to Andy, staring out the sunroof, showing no active plan or response to the urgent situation.
Expresses relief and hope upon seeing Buzz alive, eager to share the good news with others.
Weakly tries to engage Buzz in friendly conversation despite Buzz’s anger and silent treatment.
Immediately shifts to aggression and physical fighting with Buzz when provoked.
Expresses hope that Buzz's survival will solve their problem and early excitement about being saved.
Attempts to engage Buzz and persuade him that the situation is a misunderstanding, despite Buzz’s anger and lack of response.
Engages in physical fight with Buzz, using aggression but suffers a damaging blow.
Activates Buzz’s sampled voice buttons during fight to distract or gain advantage.
Runs after the van in panic but fails to catch up, realizing he is lost.
Charges at Buzz in anger, calls him an idiot, and blames him for being lost and for Andy moving away.
Despite dangerous situation, vents frustrations openly to Buzz which reveals vulnerability and fear of loss.
Charges at Buzz in anger, panics and collapses near a truck tire, expresses frustration loudly and blames Buzz for their predicament.
Inches away cautiously from the truck tire to avoid harm, moves back under the truck for safety.
Realizes the importance of Buzz and that he cannot face the situation alone, showing self-awareness of his limitations.
Attempts to reason with Buzz and calls him back by pointing out the spaceship, demonstrating quick thinking and persuasive effort.
Walks away after Buzz dismisses him, briefly giving up on the confrontation, which could be seen as a lack of assertiveness.
Speaks confidently and forcefully to Buzz initially, trying to assert authority, indicating some confidence in himself.
Does not immediately seize the opportunity of the delivery truck to advance the goal, hesitating because Buzz is not present, showing caution or dependence on Buzz.
Assures Buzz that they will find a way to get him home.
Tries to persuade Buzz to get in the back of the truck for safety.
Calls Buzz an idiot for choosing the apparently less safe cockpit.
Peeled off the back of the truck and fell into a pile of trash to rejoin Buzz, showing resourcefulness and commitment to the group.
Used a 'MEGA-GULP' cup on his head and disguised himself to help Buzz get inside, demonstrating cooperation and teamwork.
Peels off the back of the truck and falls into a pile of trash, then uses a 'MEGA-GULP' cup as a disguise to aid entry.
Disappears unexpectedly, causing Buzz to worry initially.
Quickly pulls Buzz down the corridor to follow Andy's family, showing concern and focus on Andy's safety and reunion.
Uses a straw as a periscope and reacts irritably when bumped by Buzz.
Uses a straw as a periscope to observe surroundings and directs Buzz effectively.
Quickly pulls Buzz down the corridor to pursue a special ship he just noticed, showing alertness and decisiveness.
Carefully tracks Andy and family through the arcade, patiently waiting and encouraging progress.
Gets bumped by Buzz and momentarily reacts with a mild complaint, but quickly refocuses.
Plans to coordinate a jump into the basket with Buzz and attempts to intervene quickly when Buzz leaps alone.
Momentarily distracted and misses Buzz's leap into the crane game, showing a lapse in situational awareness.
Quickly recovers from his distraction, runs toward the crane game, and immediately dives into the prize slot to follow Buzz, showing decisiveness and agility.
Leaps to tackle Buzz and hides them from Sid, risking himself to protect Buzz.
Frantically looks for escape and works to open repair door to save them.
Engages in tug-of-war with the claw to prevent Buzz from being captured.
Recognizes danger quickly upon hearing Sid's voice and immediately reacts to protect Buzz by tackling him and hiding.
Notices and uses the small repair door to attempt an escape route, demonstrating problem-solving skills.
Engages in a physical tug-of-war with the claw to save Buzz, showing resourcefulness and determination.
Attempts to physically pull Buzz out of the claw machine, showing quick reactive problem-solving and determination.
Commands aliens to stop, attempts to assert control but is overridden by their zealotry, shows some loss of influence and control.
Realizes and clearly states the danger of going into Sid's house, demonstrating awareness and foresight about the consequences.
Gets frustrated and tells aliens to be quiet, indicating impatience and difficulty managing his team effectively in a stressful situation.
Commands the toys to freeze to prevent Sid from harming the alien toy.
Shows horror and concern when Sid abuses toys.
Refers anxiously to Sid's room as a dangerous place, indicating protective concern.
Commands 'FREEZE!!!' loudly to stop Sid's action, attempting to control the situation.
Reacts with horror to Scud shaking the alien, showing alertness and emotional investment but no direct intervention in this excerpt.
Warns 'Not Sid’s room... not there...' showing awareness of the danger and situational insight.
Concerned about Janie, tries to intervene during Sid's actions.
Expresses fear but tries to find a way out to protect himself and Buzz.
Recognizes danger quickly and tries to escape immediately by bolting out of the backpack and attempting to open the locked door.
Fails to open the door and reacts by dropping to the floor, showing momentary frustration or inability to solve the lock problem quickly.
Grabs a pencil as a weapon when startled by a noise, demonstrating quick thinking and readiness to defend.
Greets the baby doll under the bed kindly, 'Hey! Hi, there, little fellah!'
Leaps onto the bed and hides behind Buzz out of fear instead of confronting the mutant toys.
Cowers in the backpack corner showing vulnerability but not taking cooperative or protective action.
Hurries to get a larger flashlight and investigates the noise under the bed, attempts to illuminate and communicate with the strange creature.
Keeps flashlight on the creature despite fear, showing presence of mind.
Leaps onto the bed and hides behind Buzz when confronted by multiple mutant toys, showing fear and retreat.
Retreats into the backpack and cowers in the corner instead of taking action against threat.
Woody is missing and presumed run away; others suspect he is guilty of wrongdoing, showing a lack of immediate presence or control of situation.
Despite being under threat (Sid's interrogation and torture), Woody is described as a 'survivor' with a strong will, implying resilience and mental toughness.
Shows determination and quick thinking to escape Sid's room; protects himself and Buzz from mutant toys by using Buzz's karate chop action.
Puts his head in a bowl of half-eaten cereal with milk to cool down his burning forehead.
Jumps up screaming and dunks face in cereal bowl when in distress from pain.
Notices the open door in the reflection and seizes the opportunity to escape.
Hides behind Buzz when threatened by mutant toys and calls for help.
Quickly realizes Buzz’s laser isn’t working and tells him to use karate chop action to fend off mutant toys.
Fends off mutant toys by using Buzz's karate chop action aggressively, shouting 'Get away! Hoo-cha!'
Drops Buzz and flees the scene
Mumbles to himself 'There’s no place like home' showing anxiety and vulnerability
Pulls Buzz's hand away when Buzz tries to prevent him from acting recklessly
Cowardly crawls across the open area avoiding danger
Vainly attempts to silence his pullstring voice box after it betrays their position
Quickly hides in a closet and slams the door shut to evade the dog, showing awareness and decisiveness under pressure.
Follows Buzz's lead to split up, indicating cooperative but reliant behavior rather than independent initiative here.
Taunts Buzz by echoing 'You are a toy! You can’t fly!'
Taunts Buzz with 'You are a toy! You can’t fly!'
Emerges from closet entangled in Christmas lights, knocks over junk, and is hit on the head by a bowling ball
Carefully creeps down the hallway dragging Christmas lights to check on Buzz
Tries to quietly interrupt Hannah's tea party to check on Buzz, shows concern for Buzz when he is down.
Clears his throat and uses a high voice to get Hannah's attention, showing tact and patience.
Removes teapot from Buzz's severed arm to stop the pretend tea party, gently indicating Buzz has had enough.
Notices Buzz's predicament and quietly tries to intervene and help by calling out to him and removing the teapot from the severed arm.
Initially hesitates and only clears his throat and uses a high voice to get Hannah's attention, instead of a more direct or confident approach.
Helps Buzz sober up by gently snapping him out of it and closing his helmet politely.
Encourages Buzz thoughtfully by admiring Buzz's idea and guiding him towards a plan.
Waves to the toys outside Sid’s window to reassure and communicate with them.
Expresses relief and happiness to see his friends again.
Encourages Slinky by praising his effort with the lights.
Defends Buzz against accusations, trying to reassure the other toys.
Insincerely pretends Buzz is responding and throws his voice to fool the others.
Attempts to foster camaraderie by showing a fake handshake and saying they are friends.
Calmly tries to convince others that Buzz is fine, uses quick improvisation to pretend Buzz is responding by throwing his voice and manipulating Buzz's arm.
Acts insincerely and somewhat desperate, exploding emotionally which may undermine confidence.
Tries to hide the severed arm after accidentally exposing it, then pleads for help and understanding from other toys.
Expresses sincere distress and desperation when the other toys reject him and leave, showing vulnerability and desire to make things right.
Immediately runs to Buzz's rescue when mutant toys converge, showing protective instincts and concern for others.
Tries to play off the severed arm incident with innocence but fails, causing other toys to panic and accuse him, showing a lack of control and poor communication.
Desperately tries to persuade other toys to stay and help, showing initiative and leadership despite the setback.
Slumps in defeat after losing support, indicating a momentary lapse in confidence and emotional resilience.
Immediately reacts to the danger to Buzz by jumping to his rescue, demonstrating quick thinking, decisiveness, and bravery.
Runs to Buzz’s rescue when he is surrounded by mutant toys.
Shields himself with Buzz's arm when attacked, showing vulnerability and reliance on others.
Calls mutant toys 'disgusting freaks' and 'cannibals,' showing fear and prejudice.
Attacks mutant toys with a vengeance to protect Buzz.
Expresses confusion and surprise when mutant toys do not harm Buzz and show care, then apologizes for his previous assumption.
Tries to help and encourage a depressed Buzz to get up despite Buzz’s limp state.
Shows frustration but continues to support Buzz, preparing to face Sid's threat together.
Runs to Buzz's rescue and aggressively attacks the mutant toys to reach him.
Cowers and loses grip during tug-of-war with Babyface, gets thrown across the room.
Quickly realizes the mutant toys have fixed Buzz and reassesses the situation, showing observation and flexibility.
Misjudges the mutant toys as cannibals again and apologizes nervously when proven wrong.
Tries to help and drag Buzz to safety despite Buzz being limp, demonstrating determination.
Expresses frustration and doubt when Buzz won’t respond, showing emotional strain impacting his actions.
Hides to avoid confrontation, allowing Buzz to be captured by Sid.
Heaves a sigh of relief when Sid’s plan is foiled by weather, indicating concern for Buzz’s safety.
Hides quietly and tries to avoid Sid to stay safe.
Gets dislodged from hiding, ends up trapped under a magazine but quickly finds cover.
Passively watches helplessly as Sid tapes Buzz to the rocket without intervening.
Encourages Buzz to help him escape and come up with a plan to get back to Andy’s house.
Attempts to boost Buzz’s morale by listing his features and emphasizing his value as a toy.
Expresses self-doubt and compares himself unfavorably to Buzz, feeling inferior and questioning his own worth.
Encourages Buzz to escape and join forces to move the milkcrate together.
Shows concern for Buzz's safety and urges caution but also supports his effort.
Leaps to save Buzz and tries to keep door closed to protect himself from Scud.
Urgently calls for help from mutant toys to save Buzz, emphasizing Buzz is his friend and only friend.
Shows frustration and panic but sincerely pleads for cooperation to save Buzz.
Kneels down into a huddle with the mutant toys and thanks Babyface, showing appreciation and inclusiveness.
Organizes the mutant toys with a detailed plan and communicates clearly, aiming to help everyone.
Creates a detailed plan using a diagram made of dominoes and Scrabble tiles, organizes a group of mutant toys, assigns roles, and gives clear instructions before executing the plan.
Acknowledges that the plan will require breaking rules but proceeds with confidence and motivates others.
Organizes a coordinated escape plan, directs the toys calmly and encourages teamwork.
Effectively coordinates a complex, multi-toy plan involving timing, signals, and teamwork to distract Scud.
Uses Rollerbob skateboard to skillfully mobilize toys quickly and efficiently.
Takes initiative and confidently gives clear commands during the operation.
Tells the mutants to lean back to help RollerBob through the doggie door, facilitating escape.
Exchanges a thumbs-up with Ducky, Legs, and The Frog after their escape attempt.
Leads the mutants through a complex escape route, gives clear instructions ('Lean back!'), and coordinates the group's movement successfully through tight spaces and obstacles.
Successfully avoids detection by Hannah and Sid through careful timing and stealth, showing situational awareness and planning.
Silently signals toys to disperse and stay prepared in a coordinated way.
Reassures Buzz in a tense situation with a quiet 'It's ok. Everything’s under control.'
Falls limp to distract Sid and protect the group despite personal danger.
Directs the mutants to their positions and initiates their plan confidently.
Deliberately plays dead on the grill to deceive Sid and prevent him from lighting the fuse.
Calmly reassures Buzz that everything is under control despite the danger.
Confronts Sid to protect the other toys from harm, warns him to take care of his toys, stands up for their well-being.
Shows sincerity when speaking directly to Sid and advocating for toys' safety.
Confronts Sid confidently despite being damaged, uses a clever scare tactic with other toys to intimidate Sid and protect them.
Commands the toys and praises them effectively after successful execution, showing leadership and strategic thinking.
Hoists Buzz off the pole he was tied to and urges everyone to run.
Jumps down from safety to help Buzz who is stuck in the fence.
Quickly hoists Buzz off the pole he was tied to and urges the group to run, showing initiative and leadership.
Easily slips through the fence slats, demonstrating agility and problem-solving.
Notices Buzz is stuck, immediately returns to help, showing responsibility and quick decision-making.
Tugs on a loosened slat and breaks Buzz free, effectively solving a problem under pressure.
Runs after the moving van despite dangers, displaying courage but with some risk-taking that could be reckless.
Keeps fighting to climb onto the truck despite being attacked by the dog, shows determination and concern for Andy's toys.
Tells Buzz to take care of Andy for him, expressing trust and concern.
Rummages through boxes quickly to find the RC car and remote.
Throws the RC car out and uses it to try to maneuver and evade the other toys and the dog.
Struggles to control the RC car while avoiding angry toys and Scud.
Is spun around by Rocky and knocked to the floor, losing control briefly.
Tries to warn the other toys to help Buzz, showing concern and initiative.
Gets tossed out by the other toys despite his warnings and is momentarily vulnerable in traffic, indicating a loss of control.
Quickly ducks to avoid an oncoming car, demonstrating situational awareness and reflexes.
Steers the RC Car skillfully to avoid a dangerous collision and switches to turbo mode to catch the truck, showing resourcefulness and confident action.
Informs others they are almost there, coordinating with Buzz and Slinky during a dangerous rescue.
Reaches out to help Slinky grasp the ramp, showing trust and concern.
Coordinates with Buzz and helps Slinky safely onto the ramp under pressure.
Clearly monitors situation and communicates effectively with teammates.
Shows calm leadership during a dangerous situation.
Encourages Slinky to hold on despite danger.
Expresses frustration sarcastically when plan fails.
Shows ingenuity and determination by using the match and Buzz’s helmet to light the rocket fuse.
Breaks down emotionally when plan fails, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Pulls out a match from his holster and attempts to light the fuse to escape.
Fails initially when a passing car blows out the match and he falls prostrate, visibly upset.
Recovers quickly from failure, notices the white hot dot on his hand, improvises by using Buzz's helmet to light the fuse successfully.
Encourages Buzz with enthusiasm ('Hey, Buzz!! You're flying!!' and joining in with 'Ha ha!! To Infinity and Beyond!!')
Manages to hold on to the RC car rocket for as long as possible despite the dangerous situation.
Realizes and alerts Buzz that they missed the truck, showing awareness of their trajectory.
Forced to let go of the RC car when it becomes unsafe, showing pragmatism and quick decision-making.
Panics by covering his eyes while falling, showing momentary fear and lack of calmness in crisis.
Woody and Buzz give each other a knowing wink after being found, suggesting friendly camaraderie and mutual trust.
Woody is mingling with the other toys like at a typical office Christmas party, showing sociability and friendliness.
Successfully lands with Buzz unnoticed in the family van's back seat next to Andy.
Shares a knowing wink with Buzz after being found by Andy, indicating awareness and shared understanding.
Mingling with toys in Andy’s room like at a casual party, momentarily distracted before responding to a call to action.
Engages warmly with Bo Peep, shares a playful kiss under the mistletoe.
Lightheartedly teases Buzz about worrying during the gift opening.
Rubs his neck after being pulled back suddenly but quickly recovers and engages in lighthearted banter with Bo Peep and Buzz.
Joins Buzz calmly on the bed despite having lipstick on his face, showing composure in front of others.
Laughs and reassures Buzz not to worry about Andy's presents, demonstrating social awareness and confidence.
Does not take charge or direct the situation during the gift opening excitement and chatter among toys.
